title: File Handling
concept: This level teaches opening files, reading content, writing output, counting words and characters, copying files, searching text, reversing lines, and generating modified output using another file. Use standard Python open(), read(), write() operations.

challenges.title: Read & Print File
challenges.description: Given a file input.txt, read full content and print it exactly.
examples:
input.txt contains:
Hello Python
Output:
Hello Python

challenges.title: Count Words
challenges.description: Print the total number of words present in input.txt.
examples:
input.txt:
Hello world from Python
Output:
4

challenges.title: Count Lines
challenges.description: Print number of lines in input.txt.

challenges.title: Character Count (No Spaces)
challenges.description: Count number of characters excluding spaces and newlines.
challenges.starterCode:
f = open('input.txt', 'r')
# count chars except space and newline

challenges.title: Copy File
challenges.description: Copy content of input.txt into output.txt exactly.
examples:
input.txt:
Hello
After running → output.txt also contains Hello
challenges.starterCode:
fin = open('input.txt', 'r')
fout = open('output.txt', 'w')
# copy content

challenges.title: Search Word
challenges.description: Given a word in input.txt, print Yes if found else No.
challenges.inputDescription: input.txt holds sentence; program must search entire text.
challenges.starterCode:
word = input().strip()
f = open('input.txt','r')
# check word in file

challenges.title: Reverse Each Line
challenges.description: Print reverse of each line from input.txt on separate lines.
examples:
input.txt:
abc
def
Output:
cba
fed

challenges.title: Longest Word
challenges.description: Print the longest word in input.txt. If tie, print first longest in file order.
examples:
input.txt: hello programming world
Output: programming

challenges.title: Remove Empty Lines
challenges.description: Read input.txt and write only non-empty lines to output.txt.
examples:
input.txt:
a

b
Output.txt:
a
b
challenges.starterCode:
fin = open('input.txt','r')
fout = open('output.txt','w')
# filter blank lines

challenges.title: Sort File Lines
challenges.description: Sort all lines alphabetically and write to output.txt.
challenges.outputDescription: Alphabetically sorted lines stored in output.txt.
examples:
input.txt:
banana
apple
carrot
Output.txt:
apple
banana
carrot
challenges.starterCode:
fin = open('input.txt','r')
fout = open('output.txt','w')
# sort lines
